Award.AwardTitle: Russia-Japan-USA-Europe Symposium on Fundamental & Applied Problems of Terahertz Devices & Technologies (RJUSE TeraTech-2017) - October 02-06, 2017, Troy, NY

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: The Russia-Japan-USA-Europe Symposium on Fundamental & Applied Problems of Terahertz Devices & Technologies will take place on October 2-6, 2017 in Troy, NY. It will address research areas in the field of interaction of THz radiation with micro- and nanostructures and advanced solid-state THz emitters and sensors. This conference will foster advances in the leading research on various types of Terahertz technology, by gathering a diverse group of experts, researchers and students. The Symposium will foster interactions between leading researchers in USA, Japan, and Russia working in the area of Terahertz Devices and Technologies. Topics cover THz emission and detection, THz devices and electronic, optical components, THz physics and applications. There will be invited talks and contributed presentations. Special attention will be paid in attracting students and post-doctoral associates, and young faculty with special emphasis to inviting women and members of the under representative minorities. The highlights of the symposium will be accessible worldwide through the symposium proceedings.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 5-th Russia–Japan–USA-Europe Symposium on Fundamental & Applied Problems of Terahertz Devices & Technologies "RJUSE TeraTech-2017" will take place on October 01-06, 2017 at the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, in Troy NY, USA. (The conference WEB site is RJUSE.org.) This advanced symposium gathered leading international experts from academia, industry, and government agencies and setup the stage for exciting breakthroughs in the terahertz field, for understanding the underlying physical mechanisms, and, for the first time in the history of this workshop, focusing on emerging applications. The participants exchanged views on future trends and directions, the market pulls and the necessary policy and infrastructure changes. This symposium enabled the interaction of THz radiation with micro- and nanostructures and advanced solid-state THz emitters and sensors. RJUSE provided the venue for the in-depth discussions of THz device physics, and the electromagnetic radiation interaction with solid state devices and systems, including THz metamaterials and understanding the underlying physical mechanisms. It fostered interactions between leading researchers in USA, Japan, Russia, and Europe working in the area of THz devices and technologies. The symposium addressed not only the recent original results but also dealt with the technical challenges and barriers of transitioning the research results into the THz system-level applications. The RJUSE-2017 paid special attention to attracting students and post-doctoral associates, and young faculty with special emphasis to inviting women and members of the under representative minorities.
